intro: Hibiscus cravenii, commonly known as the Craven’s hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with rough, hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. Hibiscus cravenii thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens in warm climates. Its blooms attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological value.
